name: innocuousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being completely harmless (= causing no harm): All changes must be reported to the medical staff regardless of the duration or innocuousness of the symptoms. We all like to believe in the innocuousness of childhood. See
innocuous
More examplesFewer examplesThe drug has been at the centre of a controversy over its innocuousness for over two years.The name was picked for its innocuousness in an industry they felt was dominated by huge egos.She represented goodness and generosity, the innocuousness of old age.
